alert.note: Alert for Columbia; Hempstead; Lafayette; Miller; Nevada (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 20 at 8:54PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Hempstead, southeastern Miller, Lafayette, southern Nevada and northwestern Columbia Counties through 945 PM CDT... At 853 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Bodcaw to near Stamps to near Lewisville to 7 miles northwest of Bradley. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Magnolia, Stamps, Waldo, Lewisville, McNeil, Bradley, Taylor, Buckner, Rosston, Willisville, Bodcaw, Bussey, Smithland, Canfield, Macedonia, Mount Vernon, Cale, Patmos, Lerch and Gin City. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for southwestern Arkansas.
